image.altText: "Tasinsure" branding is seen on a white sign in a storefront window with white and blue "Liberals" balloons.

props.synopsis: Critics of a state-owned insurance company proposal say TasInsure has "no business case ... no financial modelling and experts are saying it is extremely risky to the state's budget position", as draft legislation is produced for consultation.

title.children: Draft bill for 'extremely risky' insurance venture released

image.altText: A geographic map of a lake with depths in colour

props.synopsis: Recent CSIRO research definitively places Tasmania's Lake St Clair at 163 metres deep, nearly twice the depth of Bass Strait.

title.children: Underwater mapping of Australia's deepest lake shows 'dramatic ravines'

image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: An order to build the Macquarie Point AFL stadium on Hobart's waterfront has passed the lower house after a lengthy six-hour debate, paving the way for a deciding vote in the upper house next month.

title.children: 'Yes' vote on Macquarie Point as AFL stadium order sails through lower house

image.altText: Dozens of union members with matching t-shirts and placards at a rally.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's public sector workers have knocked back a 3 per cent pay rise that the government insists is fair given the tight budget. But what does 'fair' look like when compared to other states? Reporter Selina Bryan takes a look.

title.children: TassieCast: Union pressure for more public sector pay

image.altText: A man in protecive clothing holds a large fish.

props.synopsis: A salmon mass mortality event caused by a bacterial outbreak has given scientists "a lot of genetic knowledge" to put to use in a selective breeding program.

title.children: Tasmanian salmon resilient to bacterial disease bred like 'stud bulls'

image.altText: A person crouches next to a graffiti artwork of a smiling character, their face is hidden.

props.synopsis: Ever noticed the hundreds of smiley faces graffitied on buildings, the back of road signs, guardrails and bridges around Tasmania? The artist says the world needs more joy.

title.children: These 'silly, lighthearted' smiley tags show up all over Tasmania. This is who spray-paints them

image.altText: Donald Trump places a hand on his chest.

props.synopsis: As what's happening in Trump's America dominates our attention there is a lot going on, mostly involving everyone else around the world refashioning their politics in an environment that has never seemed more uncertain.

title.children: Trump's sagas dominate, while world leaders politely try to work around him

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: Markets are heading south on fears about the US economy and interest rates not falling. Analysts fear mortgage holders and superannuates are in the firing line.

title.children: Market meltdown 'has already started' as rate cut hopes fade

image.altText: A grocery store aisle background with the logo of the health star rating in front.

props.synopsis: Health ministers will meet next year and decide whether or not to make the system mandatory for all packaged food, something public health experts say is overdue.

title.children: Food industry misses deadline for voluntarily displaying health star ratings

image.altText: GettyImages-74010665

props.synopsis: Australia's peak body for equestrian sports received a controversial video of Olympic rider Heath Ryan appearing to whip a horse weeks before an investigation was commenced.

title.children: Equestrian Australia received controversial video weeks before probe

image.altText: Two girls, photographed from behind, sitting on a grey sofa watching TV

props.synopsis: We have navigated this new path of "what to watch/what to censor/what to allow" with stumbling footsteps. I'd love to tell you we have been perfectly consistent. We have not.

title.children: Should we let our son watch Mad Men?

image.altText: Littleproud gestures with a hand while speaking in a courtyard.

props.synopsis: The Nationals will be meeting with the Liberals on Sunday to sign off on a climate policy.

title.children: Littleproud happy to let Liberals 'dream' of net zero in Coalition deal on climate

image.altText: graphic showing rajwinder singh and photos of toyah cordingley

props.synopsis: Former Innisfail nurse Rajwinder Singh, 41, is standing trial over the 24-year-old's 2018 murder.

title.children: What we know after the first week of the Toyah Cordingley murder trial

image.altText: A woman with a headband stands in front of a willow tree on the banks of a river

props.synopsis: Aunty Thelma lived through the mission era, stolen children and forced assimilation. As she witnessed the signing of the country's first treaty, her thoughts were on those who came before.

title.children: 'Justice not division': How treaty could change Australia

image.altText: A bald man in a red soccer shirt and white shorts kicks a soccer ball on a green field near players in white and blue.

props.synopsis: A corrupt coach who was banned for life by the world football governing body for match-fixing has been quietly playing for clubs in suburban Melbourne.

title.children: Football coach banned by FIFA discovered playing in Melbourne leagues

image.altText: A man with long black hair looks neutrally at the camera

props.synopsis: Police are continuing to investigate to see if other victims of Chao Xu can be identified across two countries.

title.children: 'Dangerous and prolific' rapist jailed for life in United Kingdom

image.altText: Threatening storm clouds over a rural setting.

props.synopsis: Large hail, damaging winds and heavy rainfall are all on the cards, with another round of severe storms due to hit south-east Queensland.

title.children: Another round of severe storms to hit SEQ this weekend

image.altText: A blue bus sits damaged on a road with two yellow street lights illuminating the scene

props.synopsis: At least three people have died and another three have been injured after an empty double-decker bus crashed into a bus stop.

title.children: Several killed as bus crashes into bus stop in Stockholm

image.altText: A drone explodes during a Russian missile and drone strike in kyiv

props.synopsis: Both Russia and Ukraine accused each other of striking civilian areas in these latest attacks despite both sides saying they were hitting military targets.

title.children: Eight dead after Russia launches drone and missile attack on Ukraine

image.altText: Mahamed Hussein Abdelhag Omer

props.synopsis: Australia is set to issue its one millionth refugee visa since 1947 in the coming weeks, in a humanitarian program that grew directly out the ashes of World War II.

title.children: Australia set to issue its one millionth refugee visa since 1947

image.altText: Jannik Sinner pumps his fist at the ATP Finals.

props.synopsis: Reigning champion Jannik Sinner says he will need to produce his best tennis to get past Alex de Minaur in the semis at the season-ending ATP Finals.

title.children: Sinner wary of 'difficult' de Minaur ahead of ATP Finals semis

image.altText: James Anderson playing in the 2023 Ashes series.

props.synopsis: Legendary England fast bowler James Anderson says Australia is favourite to win the men's Ashes series on home soil, but feels the hosts will field their "weakest" team in 15 years.

title.children: England great Anderson tips Aussie Ashes win

image.altText: An aerial shot of Bento Rodrigues, Brazil

props.synopsis: A British court has ruled mining giant BHP liable for a deadly dam collapse in Brazil a decade ago, which sparked one of the world's largest environmental disasters on record.

title.children: Court finds 'pollutant' BHP liable over deadly Brazilian dam collapse

image.altText: A portrait of Guy Sebastian.

props.synopsis: Guy Sebastian looks back on the good fortune he has enjoyed in his music career, with the release of his 10th studio album, 100 Times Around the Sun.

title.children: Guy Sebastian's new album reflects on remarkable career

image.altText: Close up of the abdomen of a heavily pregnant woman

props.synopsis: The homebirth program was launched at the Sunshine Coast University Hospital in July 2024, with 74 women enrolled in the service in its first 12 months.

title.children: Nearly half of Qld homebirth program participants gave birth in hospital

image.altText: Kungka Kunp (Strong Women) at the Rock (2023) by Kaylene Whiskey.

props.synopsis: Dolly Parton has never stepped foot on the dry red dirt of Indulkana in remote South Australia, but she is a frequent visitor in the art of Kaylene Whisky, which celebrates sisterhood and strong women.

title.children: 'No one like her in the universe': Meet rising art star Kaylene Whiskey

image.altText: A pile of glass bottles

props.synopsis: Container Deposit Schemes are loved by consumers for getting a little cash back, but wineries say the financial and administrative burden outweighs any environmental boon.

title.children: Small wineries worried about 'onerous' costs of consumer recycling scheme

image.altText: Ponds surrounded by boggy farmland.

props.synopsis: A date is set for snorkellers to return Ewens Ponds on South Australia's Limestone Coast, after low water flows caused its closure to the public.

title.children: World-famous diving spot to reopen amid hopes of environmental rejuvenation

image.altText: A crowd in a street

props.synopsis: A free concert scheduled in Melbourne's Fed Square was cancelled at the last minute on Friday night, with organisers citing overcrowding.

title.children: Amyl and the Sniffers concert cancelled due to safety concerns

image.altText: A man holds a large wooden implement in front of another man who is smiling

props.synopsis: The move will affect Australia and New Zealand's multiple police and defence personnel working in Vanuatu, and could set back the signing of the Nakamal Agreement.

title.children: Vanuatu flags expulsion of Australian, NZ advisers to stop 'outside influence'

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns speaks to the media at the NSW Police Academy, Goulburn

props.synopsis: The Minns government has been unable to break an impasse after six months of trying to pass the legislation.

title.children: Premier concedes 'it's over' after 16-hour debate on workers' comp

image.altText: A woman's hand holds a tube of Bondi Sands Zinc Mineral sunscreen.

props.synopsis: A major Australian sunscreen brand, Bondi Sands is the latest to announce recalls over potential SPF concerns, and the first to remove products from shelves that have not been identified as using the same problematic base formulation.

title.children: Bondi Sands the latest brand to recall sunscreens over potential SPF concerns

image.altText: A woman plays with her son using blocks.

props.synopsis: A recall of children's coloured sand after the discovery of asbestos traces leads to the closure of multiple ACT public schools, leaving parents scrambling for care options and answers.

title.children: 'Chaos' as asbestos risk in coloured sand causes ACT school closures
